publications.title: **Navigating Bengali Linguistics: Insights from Machine and Deep Learning Perspectives for Categorization of Sentences**
notes: Accepted - (ICCIT 2023 - *International Conference on Computer and Information Technology*)
publications.description: The paper explores the classification of Bengali sentences, a crucial area for advancing natural language processing (NLP) in linguistically rich languages. Using a recently published Bengali sentence dataset (BTSD) of 3,793 samples, the study applies BERT-based, Glove-based, and TF-IDF-based vectorization approaches, achieving a notable ***98.07%*** accuracy with BERT-based vectorization. This underscores its potential for real-world applications beyond the dataset. The findings contribute to a deeper understanding of Bengali sentence structures, with implications for computational linguistics and NLP research.

publications.title: **Consistency of Contextual Embedding in Literary Texts**
publications.description: This research explores the effectiveness of contextual embedding techniques in analyzing complex literary texts. Using a small corpus of two novels by Ian Fleming and two short stories by Guy De Maupassant, the study fine-tunes the BERT model to extract contextual embeddings. The findings reveal notable contrasts within each narrative, highlighting the capability of BERT to enhance thematic consistency in literary analysis.

publications.title: **Detecting Discrepancy to Enhance the Accuracy of Sentiment and Emotion Analysis: A Study Based on Bangla E-commerce Dataset**
publications.description: This study addresses the challenges of sentiment and emotion analysis in Bangla e-commerce datasets caused by data discrepancies. A novel approach is proposed to identify and resolve inconsistencies, followed by applying the state-of-the-art BERT model for sentiment and emotion recognition. Results show significant accuracy improvements: sentiment analysis accuracy increased from **93.96% to 96.31%**, and emotion analysis improved from **90.94% to 93.59%** after data cleaning. Comparative analyses highlight the effectiveness of this approach, emphasizing discrepancy detection as a crucial preprocessing step for enhancing insights into consumer behavior.

publications.title: **Analyzing Audience Engagement in Esports: Sentiment and LLM-Based Topic Insights from Live Chats in South Asia**
notes: Accepted - (ICCIT 2024 - *International Conference on Computer and Information Technology*)
publications.description: This study explores audience engagement in esports through sentiment analysis and topic discovery, focusing on PUBG Mobile across **Bangladesh, India, and Pakistan.** Using a dataset of **15 million** live chat messages, a pre-trained **RoBERTa** model categorized user sentiments, revealing a notable increase in positive sentiment among Bangladeshi viewers. The **Gemma 7b-it** model identified key discussion topics, including gameplay strategies and community interactions. Findings highlight a strong link between view counts and engagement, presenting opportunities for advertisers to reach dedicated fans. Despite limitations like dataset scope and resource constraints, the research provides valuable insights into real-time esports engagement, paving the way for future multimodal studies.

publications.title: **Explainable AI-Driven Improved Disease Prediction through Symptom Analysis with Custom BERT**
notes: Accepted - (ICCIT 2024 - *International Conference on Computer and Information Technology*)
publications.description: This study introduces a custom BERT-based hybrid model for disease prediction from patient symptom descriptions, using the Symptom2Disease dataset with 1,200 samples across 24 disease categories. The model integrates Explainable AI (XAI) techniques for transparency and employs dropout to prevent overfitting, achieving 99% accuracy. The inclusion of XAI enables word-level contribution visualizations, offering insights into symptom influence. This model demonstrates higher accuracy and faster training times, making it both effective and computationally efficient for medical applications.

publications.title: **Live and mediated user engagements: A comparative dataset from two Bengali audio-story based youtube channels**
publications.description: This dataset contains user engagement and language data from two YouTube audio story channels, covering 230 stories from July 2022 to February 2024. It includes over 250,000 comments, 300,000 live chats, and quantitative metrics such as views, likes, and comments, along with language categorization of user comments. The dataset offers insights into live versus post-live interactions, digital engagement patterns, and language use. It is a valuable resource for research in digital media, linguistics, and social media analysis, as well as for content creators and marketers to optimize audience engagement strategies.
